title: Clearing out emotional baggage': How Chinaâ€™s sleepmakers are helping the '996' generation
content: A new profession in China, known as sleepmakers, has emerged to help individuals deal with sleep deprivation caused by stress. Sleepmakers provide emotional support and engaging conversations to aid sleep. They operate online and offline, earning up to 260 yuan per hour. Clients, mainly young adults, find relief in discussing their problems. Popular sleepmaker Sevenseven7 uses imaginative bedtime stories to attract audiences.
summary: A new profession in China, known as sleepmakers, has emerged to help individuals deal with sleep deprivation caused by stress. Sleepmakers provide emotional support and engaging conversations to aid sleep. They operate online and offline, earning up to 260 yuan per hour. Clients, mainly young adults, find relief in discussing their problems. Popular sleepmaker Sevenseven7 uses imaginative bedtime stories to attract audiences.

title: Kamala Harris endorses tax cut for tips, Donald Trump accuses her of 'copying his policy'
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris pledged to fight for working families by eliminating taxes on tips, a stance aligning with Donald Trump's earlier proposal. Campaigning with Minnesota Governor Tim Walz in swing states, Harris leads Trump in polls within key battlegrounds. Her recent Nevada visit and subsequent fundraiser in California highlighted her campaign efforts.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris pledged to fight for working families by eliminating taxes on tips, a stance aligning with Donald Trump's earlier proposal. Campaigning with Minnesota Governor Tim Walz in swing states, Harris leads Trump in polls within key battlegrounds. Her recent Nevada visit and subsequent fundraiser in California highlighted her campaign efforts.

Not born in the year of the dog? You're hired: China's zodiac job quirks
content: Sanxing Transportation in Guangdong, China, drew attention for its job listing, which excluded applicants born in the Year of the Dog. The company believed employees with this zodiac sign would clash with their dragon-born boss. Social media users criticized the practice as discriminatory, though a lawyer highlighted that such superstitions are not currently illegal.
summary: Sanxing Transportation in Guangdong, China, drew attention for its job listing, which excluded applicants born in the Year of the Dog. The company believed employees with this zodiac sign would clash with their dragon-born boss. Social media users criticized the practice as discriminatory, though a lawyer highlighted that such superstitions are not currently illegal.

Prince Harry, Meghan Markle face tension as Duke is 'bored' with new life in US: Report
content: Prince Harry, residing in the United States since 2020, reportedly faced boredom and missed his old friends in the UK. Royal expert Tom Quinn mentioned that Harry's lack of day-to-day activities has created tension with Meghan Markle, who is busy with her projects. Harry misses the UK, adding to his unease.
summary: Prince Harry, residing in the United States since 2020, reportedly faced boredom and missed his old friends in the UK. Royal expert Tom Quinn mentioned that Harry's lack of day-to-day activities has created tension with Meghan Markle, who is busy with her projects. Harry misses the UK, adding to his unease.

title: Philippines' Marcos condemns China's 'illegal and reckless' actions over disputed reef
content: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos condemned 'illegal and reckless' actions by China after Chinese aircraft dropped flares near a Filipino military plane patrolling Scarborough Shoal. The incident, which endangered the crew, occurred during a routine Philippine Air Force operation. China claimed it acted lawfully to drive away the aircraft from its claimed territory.
summary: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos condemned 'illegal and reckless' actions by China after Chinese aircraft dropped flares near a Filipino military plane patrolling Scarborough Shoal. The incident, which endangered the crew, occurred during a routine Philippine Air Force operation. China claimed it acted lawfully to drive away the aircraft from its claimed territory.

title: Thousands protest in Serbia against revival of controversial Lithium mining project
War-torn Gaza faces rising child health threats: Hepatitis and skin diseases surge amid water crisis
content: In Gaza, children faced severe health issues, including hepatitis and skin ailments, due to a lack of clean water. The ongoing conflict damaged essential infrastructure like desalination plants and water wells. Humanitarian efforts to restore clean water have been hindered, leading to increased disease cases. The UN reported restoring electricity to a desalination plant to aid people, but risks remain high.
summary: In Gaza, children faced severe health issues, including hepatitis and skin ailments, due to a lack of clean water. The ongoing conflict damaged essential infrastructure like desalination plants and water wells. Humanitarian efforts to restore clean water have been hindered, leading to increased disease cases. The UN reported restoring electricity to a desalination plant to aid people, but risks remain high.

title: TikToker raises over $320,000 for 90-year-old man forced to pawn Jewellery to take care of his wife
content: A TikToker raised over $320,000 for a 90-year-old Air Force veteran, Donald, who was selling his jewelry to pay overdue rent and avoid eviction with his wife suffering from dementia. TikToker Jenelle Marie first handed him $1,200, helping him settle his debt and keep his jewelry. She is now assisting them in finding stable housing.
summary: A TikToker raised over $320,000 for a 90-year-old Air Force veteran, Donald, who was selling his jewelry to pay overdue rent and avoid eviction with his wife suffering from dementia. TikToker Jenelle Marie first handed him $1,200, helping him settle his debt and keep his jewelry. She is now assisting them in finding stable housing.

SpaceX launches 21 Starlink satellites into orbit from Cape Canaveral
content: A Falcon 9 rocket launched from Cape Canaveral successfully placed 21 Starlink satellites in orbit on Saturday. Of these, 13 have direct-to-cell capability. This marks the 187th Starlink mission, bringing the total to 6,854 satellites. SpaceX plans two more launches on Sunday, deploying additional Starlink satellites and Arctic broadband relay stations.
summary: A Falcon 9 rocket launched from Cape Canaveral successfully placed 21 Starlink satellites in orbit on Saturday. Of these, 13 have direct-to-cell capability. This marks the 187th Starlink mission, bringing the total to 6,854 satellites. SpaceX plans two more launches on Sunday, deploying additional Starlink satellites and Arctic broadband relay stations.
